title: Here Are 21 Personal Care Products From Target That Deserve A Spot In Your Everyday Routine
description: These products' love language is self-care.
content:
A bottle of Being Frenshe scent mist that I swear by for fresh-smelling...everything. This works well for anyone who likes one-and-done products, as this can act as a body, hair, or even linen mist. Plus, all of Being Frenshe's products contain a mood-boosting scent technology, meaning it'll help you relax while you waft in your new fave scent.

Or a reusable silk eye mask just in case a weighted eye mask feels like too much pressure for you. This helps to block out light while feeling super plush and soft against your delicate eye area.

before shaving (like a shaving cream) to help create a smoother razor glide across the skin. Oh, and it smells just like the brand's beloved An Eos vanilla cashmere shave oil so that you can up the luxe vibes of your #EverythingShower! Apply this shave oilshaving (like a shaving cream) to help create a smoother razor glide across the skin. Oh, and it smells just like the brand's beloved vanilla cashmere body lotion — warm vanilla, soft musk, and cozy caramel galore!

know you had your eight hours of self-care beauty rest. This lightweight yet nourishing oil contains 1% Granactive Retinoid that helps to smooth and clear skin. And aside from its gorg blue color, it's also packed with antioxidant-rich blueberry extract! An E.l.f. Blue-ty sleep oil packed with ingredients that'll let peopleyou had your eight hours of self-care beauty rest. This lightweight yet nourishing oil contains 1% Granactive Retinoid that helps to smooth and clear skin. And aside from its gorg blue color, it's also packed with antioxidant-rich blueberry extract!

A luxurious leave-on lip mask to say goodbye to chapped lips once and for all. This mask is like a blast of hydration, containing a trio of hyaluronic acid, castor seed oil, and squalene to create plump, pillowy puckers. This will help moisturize your lips while you snooze away or whenever you feel dryness coming on!

A pair of exfoliating gloves because they are the easiest way to get rid of ingrown hairs or start your journey toward smoother, more radiant skin. Instead of awkwardly trying to loofah hard-to-reach areas, try these gloves that are as easy to use as gliding your hands across your skin.

An Eva NYC therapy session mask that will seriously help heal your hair health (like a therapy sesh for your hair, hence the name). Shiny strands rely on hair health, and hair health relies on a balance of moisture and protein. This mask has both argan oil to seal hydration into the hair and plant proteins to help heal broken bonds.

A box of sleep earplugs since personal care means doing anything to ensure you get eight hours of sleep. If you share a bed with a loud snorer, or simply live on a bustling street, these earplugs will help block out noise so that you can sleep alllll throughout the night.

An ESW Beauty sheet mask duo set that comes with one matcha almond milk mask and one vanilla oat milk mask to help soothe dull, dry skin! This is a must if, despite your go-to hydrating skincare routine, you still need a little boost of glow in your week.

And a micellar water for the first step in your nighttime skincare routine — removing your makeup. This micellar water is great because it removes ALL makeup, including waterproof mascara! And the best part? Micellar water only removes impurities, meaning it's nonstripping and generally great for those with dry skin.
summary: The article discusses 21 personal care products from Target, including a bottle of Being Frenshe scent mist, which is known for its mood-boosting scent technology and can be used as a body, hair, or even linen mist. The products also contain a silk eye mask that blocks out light and provides a smooth shave oilshaving experience. An E.l.f. oil contains 1% Granactive Retinoid, which helps smooth and clear skin and is also packed with antioxidant-rich blueberry extract. Other products include an An Eos vanilla cashmere shave oil, an E. E.o. sleep oil, a sleep mask, a leave-on lip mask, and a micellar water that removes all makeup, particularly for those with dry skin.
shortSummary: Target.com offers 21 essential personal care products, including Being Frenshe's signature scent mist, which can enhance skin care, make-up, and include sleep-enhancing sleep oil, micellar water, and even a reusable silk eye mask.

@ash.dash.pash ☁️New Blog Alert: Revamp Your Space with Target Finds! 🛌 Just refreshed my apartment with some amazing finds from Target’s Casa Luna and Threshold collections! 🛏️From luxe organic cotton sheets to silk pillowcases, my space and sleep has never been better. Dive into my latest blog post where I share all the details on choosing sustainable, stylish home essentials that don’t just look good—they feel good. Plus, get a sneak peek at my must-have items and why they’re perfect for any season! 🏡 👉🏾click the link in bio to read more! #HomeDecor #SustainableLiving #TargetFinds #CasaLuna #BungalowStyle #InteriorDesign #ashdashpash

1. A 12-pack of bath bombs so pretty, you might have a hard time actually using them in the bath, because it'll break your heart watching these gorg babes fizzle away. Don't worry, you can always order more!
2. A colorful cloud-shaped bath bomb made with green tea, honey, lavender, and chamomile to help to transport you ~somewhere over the rainbow~, where everyday stresses and responsibilities don't exist. 😍
Promising review: "I try to keep bath time fun for my 3 year old and these do the trick!!! They are a nice size, last, smell amazing and make the water look so pretty!! I also add glow sticks in the water and it looks cool with this bath bomb. The white part of the bath bomb foams up and looks so cool. These would make great gifts! I loved them so much that I bought more for our daughter. My husband even thought they were cool." —Heather Kistler
Price: $19.99 (for a set of four)
3. A kids' bath bomb by Two Sisters, each with their own unique color, scent, and figurine inside, which is some serious bath-time motivation for little ones.
Promising review: "I love everything about this bath bomb! I was having a really bad day and I popped this little guy in the bath. Not only did it smell super good, but it colored all the water of my large tub! The little squishy inside comes in a capsule so it doesn’t get wet. Love it!" –Kerrigan
Price: $6.99+ (available in 11 varieties)
And here are some other products that'll make bath time even better!
4. A birthday cake bomb to get if it's your birthday, a friend's birthday, a family member's birthday, or if you just really love birthday cake, darn it!
5. A six-pack of stress-relieving bath bombs here to grant your body and your senses the gift of pure, unbridled ~relaxation~.
Promising review: "I absolutely love these. I always order and reorder as soon as I’m on my last two. I love how moisturizing they are and the scent is so pretty (not artificial). I can’t say enough about how good they are. Also how pretty and elegant they look (I put them in a glass jar and display them)...The bath bombs are bomb." –Mario V.
Price: $35.99
6. Or! A 10-pack of lavender bath bombs perfect for your self-care routine — just drop one of these in the tub, let it fizz, and enjoy a very relaxing bath.
7. A 12-pack of assorted fizzers with a free bar of handmade soap to seriously spice up your bathroom — sorry, is this a five star spa or your restroom? I can't tell.
8. A set of adorable bath bombs whose cupcake- and donut-shaped exteriors only *look* sweet, but actually smell of lavender, mango, lemongrass, and other forms of fruity goodness.
Promising review: "These are perfect! Not only are they beautifully wrapped but they are just adorable. Each bath bomb is individually wrapped and it comes with this really nifty tool to be able to open them from their wrapper! Very creative idea and actually super helpful! Highly recommend as a gift. They all smell amazing and left my skin feeling so soft!" –Jessica Panek
Price: $14.99+ (for a set of six; available in two styles; clip the coupon on the product page to save 20%)
9. An eight-pack of solar system-inspired bath bombs, which includes every last member of the My Very Educated Mother Just Served Us Nachos mnemonic device. Sorry, Pluto.
Promising review: "My grandson loves the planets and loves bath bombs – so, a great combo. Cool-looking, smell wonderful. A big hit." —Amazon Customer
Price: $24.97
10. A 24-pack of colorful bath bombs so pretty, you'll probably want to keep them on display in your bathroom. They'll look so good in a glass jar *or* storage basket.
11. A six-pack of mermaid bath bombs for your tiny humans who love, love, love the ocean. Each bath bomb has a surprise bracelet inside too, making bath time so much more fun.
12. Or! A unicorn-themed bath bomb set so ~magical~, your kids will be like, "I can't wait to take a bath again!". Plus, each bomb has a lil' unicorn toy inside!
13. A six-pack of moisturizing bath bombs that'll give your skin a hydrating boost as you sit in the tub.
14. Rose vanilla bath bombs because they'll give you that spa experience you need after a long week. Using these is like bathing in a garden.
15. Strawberry bath bombs that'll make you feel like it's summertime all year round. Strawberry enthusiasts, these are for you!
16. A eucalyptus and tea tree bath bomb that'll help you find your zen.
17. A set of kid-friendly bath bombs from Crayola in fun, undersea shapes, to make bathtime a little more mermaid-rific.
18. A set of dino egg bath bombs with a fun little surprise inside — even if your kid hates taking a bath, they won't be able to resist a little prehistoric playtime.
19. A set of aromatherapy tablets for your ~shower~ so you can enjoy some deep relaxation even if you don't have a tub. Their eucalyptus and menthol formula creates a luxurious effect in even the tiniest of standing showers.
20. A 365 by Whole Foods Market bath bomb because it's gentle oatmeal and shea butter scent will relax you almost immediately. Plus, the skin-softening formula will give you a luxurious spa experience for less than $5!
21. A set of six bath bombs made with real flowers because it'll make your tub and your skin smell like your favorite flower.
22. A pack of 15 calming shower steamers for those of us who don't have a bathtub. It'll give you the luxurious aroma of a bath bomb while you shower.
23. A detox bath bomb that'll help improve your skin texture with orange and ginger extracts.
24. A pack of 30 kids bombs that'll make bath time so much more fun for your little one. Each bath bomb contains a little surprise inside.
25. Diamond-shaped bath bombs that'll make you feel like royalty every time you use them.
26. Bath bombs infused with antioxidants because they'll help provide stress relief, even for bathers with sensitive skin.
27. Frida Baby vapor bath bombs to help you breathe a little easier. Sure, these are made for kids but nobody can stop you from using one whenever you need a little eucalyptus in your life.
28. Color bath fizzies to teach your little one colors during bath time. Drop one color in at a time and watch the water change as the tablets mix.
29. Inspirational bath bombs because sometimes you need a pick-me-up. They're made with essential oils and shea butter for a luxurious, uplifting experience.
30. Fruity bath bombs that'll expose a fruit-shaped toy as they dissolve. They're made with natural ingredients and release a fruit-inspired scent.
Reviews for this post have been edited for length and/or clarity.

1. A tote gym bag in a *~brat~* green (and two other vibrant options) that'll have you lookin' like an icon and hype you up to work out just as much as your Charli XCX playlist. It has three compartments inside to hold all your stuff *and* should fit in most gym lockers.
2. An Adidas gym bag, perfect for anyone who is typically dressed head-to-to in the brand to head to the gym anyways! Might as well take your coordination to the next level, right? It comes in three sizes, so whether you only want to stow sneakers and a water bottle or need to fit a basketball, you'll be all set.
Promising review: "This bag is huge for a small bag, and it’s PERFECT! I use it for the gym and keeping my work uniforms in! Lots of pockets and space! Has a great pocket with breathable holes to put shoes, so they don’t mess up your clothes! I was worried my shoes wouldn’t fit, but they fit with a little work, and I wear a 10.5 shoe size. Love the green color too!" —Brighton Dowen
Get it from Amazon for $27+ (available in three sizes and 22 designs).
3. A fan-favorite duffel bag Amazon reviewers cannot stop raving about — it has over 29,000 5-star reviews, so you know it's the real deal. It'll support you just as much as your cardio-loving bestie who is forever pestering you to meet her at the gym because, sigh, "It'll be good for you." Alas, they're not wrong!
Promising review: "I love, love, love this bag! It’s roomy, with lots of storage inside and out. Great quality and water-resistant. I use it as a gym bag, but it can be used as a weekend bag also. I like the use of handle straps and shoulder strap. One of my best bag purchases. I might buy another one for myself or a gift." —D Alexander
Get it from Amazon for $17.99+ (available two sizes and 58 styles).
4. A gym bag starring a shoe compartment for anyone who lives for their spin class but does *not* enjoy storing their cycling shoes in the same space as their face towel (yuck). Keep 'em separate until you get to the gym, slip 'em on, click in, and enjoy the riiiiiide (literally).
Promising review: "I bought this after my old bag finally (finally!) fell apart after seven years. I had the same brand/model, and it worked wonderfully! I just overloaded the netting for the water bottle, which eventually tore apart over time. Super happy to buy a new bag and treat it better this time. Know this bag will hold your gym clothes, shoes, and any gear and will last for years (even if abused a bit)." —Bryce
Get it from Amazon for $26.99+ (clip the coupon on the product page to save $2 on select styles; available in two sizes and five colors).
5. An All in Motion duffel bag that's so cute you'll want to take it out on a coffee date to get to know it — or, ya know, throw an OOTD and shower essentials in it for your post-workout routine.
6. A Fila gym bag starring a ventilated compartment so your sweaty post-workout clothes won't wreak havoc on your new lovely new bag by leaving a less-than-pleasant scent behind.
Promising review: "I love this sports duffel! The colors are true to the pic and it will work great for me as a tennis coach (our main school color is purple, which is awesome). Now I have an easy way to carry my physicals, first aid kit, and other necessary items. I can’t express how happy I am with the durable zippers. I also appreciate that the main part of the duffel has two zippers so it can be locked." —Fontaine
Get it from Amazon for $22.02+ (clip the coupon on the product page to save 10%; available in five colors).
7. A yoga mat bag so that when you've finally reached the end of a tough class, you can let your mind quietly enjoy the moment instead of wandering directly to "Ugh, I awkwardly have to lug this mat home after this."
Promising review: "This is a nice yoga bag that's roomy enough to accommodate my yoga shoes and a towel. The bag has additional pockets for items like a cell phone and wallet. I like this bag and would definitely recommend." —Holly Stryker
Get it from Amazon for $16.98+ (clip the coupon on the product page to save 15%; available in eight styles).
8. Or a tote bag with a slot to slide your yoga mat into after you're done with your class — it'll have plenty of room for you to toss other items into, like a towel, your phone, keys, the absolutely necessary bottle of Mario Badescu facial spray you use to refresh yourself with after contorting your body for an hour, and of course a water bottle.
Promising review: "I love this bag so much! It can easily hold my two cork yoga blocks, 32-oz Hydro Flask, yoga towel, change of clothes, wallet, keys, etc., on the interior with my Jade Yoga Harmony mat rolled up and in the yoga mat exterior loop. I find this bag comfortable to carry and appreciate how much I can fit in it when I go to the studio. I would definitely recommend this bag to anyone with an average thickness of yoga mat." —Britt
Get it from Amazon for $19.94+ (available in six styles).
9. A pickleball tote bag with a specific attachment to store your paddles plus ample space for balls and accessories so you can focus on crushing your opponents instead of rummaging through an unorganized duffel.
Promising review: "It looks great, and holds all my pickle gear. I keep my rackets, balls, shoes, sunglasses, and sunblock in it, and there is still room to throw in a water bottle, sweatshirt, and other stuff." —Nancy Shamberg
Get it from Amazon for $49.99 (available in six styles).
10. An expandable gym bag explicitly designed to fit martial arts gear, so you can focus on having your best sparring sesh ever instead of fighting to squeeze your gloves into a too-small space. It also has a hardshell pocket to safely store your phone, sunglasses, and earbuds! Rocky would've been yelling, "ADRIAN, I NEED ONE OF THESE BAGS!" after seeing you with one.
Elite Sports is a small business!
Promising review: "This bag has many pockets for all my gym gear needs and items big and small. It extends at the bottom and fits all my Muay Thai gear, including my long shin guards. It also has an additional strap to carry duffel bag style. I could even use it for hiking or a weekend trip, so it's very versatile." —babb4214
Get it from Amazon for $49.99.
11. An Alo Yoga bag you'll cherish as much as your fave leggings — besides being downright practical, it's rather sleek 'n' stylish! It doesn't try to be anything it's not. It's simply a reliable bag with enough room to carry all your stuff so you can focus on getting a workout in without stressing over how to carry it all to the gym.
Promising review: "Durable, stylish, and spacious—perfect for travel, work or the gym." —Justine M.
Get it from Alo Yoga for $398.
12. A gym duffel bag that'll just be hanging out here until you finally decide to upgrade from the ripped-up tote with holes in it you've been using to carry your sneakers and water to the gym after work. Go ahead, take the plunge.
Promising review: "I love this bag soooo much!!! I use it as my everyday gym bag and for my work lunches and just everything! When I go out with my daughter I use it as a diaper bag. There’s lots of space for everything I need when going to work and working out. I also just keep diapers and wipes as well as extra clothes in it at all times. It has a good pocket on the side for my feminine hygiene products as well." —Lacy Lonergan
Get it from Amazon for $19.99+ (available in six colors).
13. A Gymshark bag you'll love toting around (literally) to the gym and beyond — it comes in three great colorways, has a slip pocket on the inside for your earbuds/wallet, a pocket on the outside for your phone, and just enough space to ensure you don't stuff it with things you *think* you might need but, honestly, don't.
14. A water-resistant Bagsmart duffel you can use as your go-to overnight bag *and* gym bag — your little beige-loving heart is going to burst once you lay your eyes on this one, friends. Dare I say that a bag designed to be filled with stinky sneakers and your sweaty sports bra is super chic?
Check out a full review on TikTok!
Promising review: "This gym bag is everything! Looks just like the pictures, and the detachable shoulder strap is so convenient. This bag fits my gym shoes and barbell pad with room to spare, plus all the pockets make it super easy to stay organized. This bag is lightweight, durable and the zippers are smooth. Would definitely recommend!!" —McKenzie
Get it from Amazon for $24.21+ (available in two sizes and 10 colors).
15. Or a more pared-down version from the same brand in case you aren't in need of so many compartments inside your gym bag — this shoulder tote is lovely with plenty of storage space, a zip-top, *and* a yoga mat strap. It comes in so many colors you might need to flip a coin to decide which belongs in your cart.
Promising review: "This is the perfect tote. You absolutely NEED it. The size is great for your gym needs (yoga mat strap included), school books (laptop sleeve included), and even a night out of town! It’s also the prettiest shade of ballerina pink, perfect for any girly girl! This is my favorite Amazon purchase of the year." —Sierra Granada
Get it from Amazon for $33.99+ (available in two sizes and 17 colors).
16. A durable gym bag boasting a wet pocket, a must-have for swimmers who are sick and tired of shoving their damp suit into a plastic bag before tossing it into their bag. It also has a shoe compartment to store your slides or flip-flops. (No one wants to shower barefoot at the gym, do they?)
Promising review: "I love this bag! I have had it for four months now and use it twice a week for the gym. The biggest perk is all the compartments and space! Space for your shoes and wet clothes, and I love the side and front pockets where I can store my hair ties, face towels, and everything else. The inside is super spacious and could easily be a weekend bag. I love it!" —Niesha N Cyr
Get it from Amazon for $28.99+ (available in two sizes and eight colors).
17. A Nike Gym Club bag you certainly can't go wrong with — it's simple, sleek, and won't get in the way of *~workin' on your fitness~* a la Fergie. It has enough room for sneakers, a change of clothes, snacks, body wash, a Snickers bar, your passport, an expired coupon to Bed Bath & Beyond, a written note from your mom reminding you to pick up toilet paper, etc.
Promising review: "This is a great lightweight bag if you are looking for something that’s not too big and bulky for trips to the gym, etc. There is enough space to store the essentials needed for after a workout whilst being compact enough to fit easily in a locker." —Cambuslang
Get it from Nike for $35.97+ (originally $42; available in four colors).
18. A small Dagne Dover carryall bag made from a forgiving neoprene material, so if you accidentally spill your post-workout smoothie all over it you won't destroy it (phew). It has enough space for over-ear headphones, keys, wallet, and water and is a great option for anyone who *doesn't* need to bring a ton of stuff to the gym.
Promising review: "I've purchased this bag several times for myself and as a gift. Organizing your bag is incredibly easy with all the pockets. It's amazing how large the small duffel is. I've fit a whole lunch with bottled water in it before." —Marybeth
Get it from Dagne Dover for $160+ (available in four sizes and 11 colors).
Psst: if you love the design of this bag but need something bigger to hold dumbbells or boxing gloves (whatever!), you can check it out on Nordstrom in an XL size for $260.
19. A waterproof duffel bag that'll make trips to the gym feel much less stressful — no more rummaging through minutes before your pilates class is about to begin trying to find where exactly you put your socks while everyone else is getting a prime spot in the room. This bag is chock full of separate compartments to keep everything easily accessible.
Promising review: "It’s big enough to hold shower stuff and a change of clothes, depending on what shoes you’re packing. That’s exactly the size I wanted. I normally carry my 64-oz water bottle, barbell clips, gloves, a towel, change of shoes, resistance bands, headphones, and the armband phone holder for runs. With plenty of space left." —Mikala
Get it from Amazon for $16.99+ (available in two sizes and seven colors).
20. A Lululemon bag with a shoulder strap you can detach to carry your yoga mat or use as a stretching strap — multifunctional *and* fabulous all at once! The dark forest green is everyyyyyything (though don't worry, it also comes in black).
Promising review: "This is a great bag. It’s a good size to pack a few gym outfits, and I love how there is a separate pocket for my running shoes, so when I do outdoor workouts, it doesn’t dirty the inside of my bag. The shoulder strap is really comfortable and stretchy on my shoulder." —Kimm
Get it from Lululemon for $158 (available in two colors).
21. A reviewer-loved gym bag sporting (pun intended) over 8K 5-star reviews, a plastic-lined zipper area for wet clothes, outside pockets for your water bottle, and a bottom zip-out area for shoes. Simply, it has it all without bankrupting you from paying for the actual gym. 😉
Promising review: "This is my new go-to gym bag! I ordered the medium beige. I am a nurse and like to work out before my shift starts in the morning; this bag has a slot to hold everything I need to get ready for my shift at the gym. I love that there’s a separate slot for your wet clothes, dry clothes, and shoes; that way, all stuff can still be organized and not be mixed together! The bag itself is easy to clean. I absolutely love the color, although deciding which one to go with was hard. Definitely worth it for the price !" —Lisa
Get it from Amazon for $25.98+ (available in two sizes and 17 colors).
22. A Stanley All Day Carry-All bag designed specifically to hold your emotional support 40-oz tumbler, your phone, and your license — aka everything you need if you're not quite a Gym Rat but like to pop in and out of a Zumba class from time to time. No need to even visit the locker room when you've got everything you need riiiiiiight here (picture me lovingly patting my crossbody bag, hehe).
This is what I take when heading to the gym! I'm not someone who needs all that much, just something to clip my keys to, some water, my phone, and my license (so I can drive there, duh). I toss my headphones around my neck, and I'm good to go, thanks to this handy-dandy crossbody!
Promising review: "Very convenient for carrying! It does exactly what it was designed to do. Love it! It actually fits 30- or 40-oz cups. It's just looser, but it still works. If there were a negative, it would be the cost, but it's quality and convenient, so I paid it." —Miss CEECEE
Get it from Amazon for $38+ (available in eight colors and two sizes).
23. A Calpak Luka duffel bag that'll offer plenty of space for everything from your your fav workout outfit to your towel to shower off after getting sweaty. Plus, it's got a separate compartment for your stinky sneakers.
24. Or a Calpak gym bag to hold your yoga mat, a large water bottle, and protein powder container. And it's stylish to boot!
25. A waterproof drawstring gym backpack because it'll keep your hands free as you trek to and fro Zumba class.
26. A Baggu nylon backpack that'll be perfect for holding your gym essentials or whatever you need for your next adventure. It's even got a laptop sleeve in case you want to also use it for school or work.
27. A lightweight backpack that has allll the space and pockets you could possibly need despite its surprisingly small size. If a phone pocket, 20-liter capacity, laptop and iPad compartment, multiple storage pockets, and more aren't enough for your gym bag.... you may want to reevaluate what you're planning to work out.
28. A packable hiking daypack available in a 24-L version that can ACTUALLY fit in your pocket when it's folded up. When unfolded, this will be your next lightweight travel BFF.
29. An Osprey day pack that you'll be delighted by, on account of just how many knickknacks you can stuff in here and still feel like you're wearing nothing on your back.
30. A Carhartt mini backpack you'll realize is almost too functional the moment you're digging around in it to find your keys.
Some reviews have been edited for length and/or clarity.

argos_summary: The article presents an extensive roundup of self‑care products, featuring body mists, eye masks, shaving oil, sleep oil, lip mask, exfoliating gloves, a hair therapy mask, earplugs, sheet masks, and micellar water. It also highlights a Target home‑decor blog post about sustainable sleep essentials. Additionally, the piece includes a detailed list of bath bombs—each with unique scents, shapes, and kid‑friendly surprises—alongside a comprehensive review of various gym and workout bags. Overall, it serves as a guide for readers looking to enhance their personal care routine and home environment with a wide range of curated items.
